page.title: 10Wirral Talking Newspaper
page.content: Our first year group visited the recording studios, and talked to the organisers and sat in on a recording session. The Talking Newspaper is for the blind. Editors collect news items on Thursday morning from the Wirral News paper. On Thursday evening these are put on to a tape at The Christian Centre (former Childrens Hospital). The recording studio has two rooms. Two people deal with recording clarity and volume .In another room is a presenter and four readers at a table. In front of each reader are news items Near each reader are three lights - red,yellow,green -telling them when to read or stop.When the readers approach the end of their paragraphs they put up their hand and the next gets ready. We had to keep totally silent while we listened to them.
